questions.question_text_1: THIS IS QUESTION PAPER FOR THE SUBJECT "FOUNDATION LEVEL : STATISTICS FOR DATA SCIENCE I (COMPUTER BASED EXAM)" ARE YOU SURE YOU HAVE TO WRITE EXAM FOR THIS SUBJECT? CROSS CHECK YOUR HALL TICKET TO CONFIRM THE SUBJECTS TO BE WRITTEN. (IF IT IS NOT THE CORRECT SUBJECT, PLS CHECK THE SECTION AT THE TOP FOR THE SUBJECTS REGISTERED BY YOU)

questions.question_text_1: A survey of 800 students shows that 65% like reading and 50% like painting. If each student likes at least one of the two activities, how many students like painting but not reading?
question_texts: A survey of 800 students shows that 65% like reading and 50% like painting. If each student likes at least one of the two activities, how many students like painting but not reading?

questions.question_text_1: How many numbers greater than 10,000 can be formed using the digits 0, 2, 5, 4, 6, 8 without repetition?
question_texts: How many numbers greater than 10,000 can be formed using the digits 0, 2, 5, 4, 6, 8 without repetition?

questions.question_text_1: In a quiz competition, eight students are competing, each assigned a roll number from 1 to 8. What is the probability that only students with prime-numbered roll numbers (i.e., 2, 3, 5, 7) secure the top four ranks, in any order? Enter the answer correct to three decimal places.
question_texts: In a quiz competition, eight students are competing, each assigned a roll number from 1 to 8. What is the probability that only students with prime-numbered roll numbers (i.e., 2, 3, 5, 7) secure the top four ranks, in any order? Enter the answer correct to three decimal places.

questions.question_text_1: A company has 15 offices and wants to set up two-way communication between every pair of offices. However, the 3 smallest offices will not have direct communication with one another, though each of them can still connect directly with the remaining offices. How many communication channels are needed in total?
question_texts: A company has 15 offices and wants to set up two-way communication between every pair of offices. However, the 3 smallest offices will not have direct communication with one another, though each of them can still connect directly with the remaining offices. How many communication channels are needed in total?

questions.question_text_1: A group of 4 teachers and 4 students is to be seated around a circular table for a discussion. They decide that all students must sit together. Find the number of ways they can be seated around the table such that all students are sitting together.
question_texts: A group of 4 teachers and 4 students is to be seated around a circular table for a discussion. They decide that all students must sit together. Find the number of ways they can be seated around the table such that all students are sitting together.

questions.question_text_1: A basket contains 5 red balls and 4 green balls. If 3 balls are to be selected at random without replacement, in how many ways can the balls be selected such that at least one green ball is included?
question_texts: A basket contains 5 red balls and 4 green balls. If 3 balls are to be selected at random without replacement, in how many ways can the balls be selected such that at least one green ball is included?

questions.question_text_1: How many 5-digit numbers can be formed using the digits 0, 2, 3, 4, and 7 where digits may be repeated such that the number is divisible by 2 ?
question_texts: How many 5-digit numbers can be formed using the digits 0, 2, 3, 4, and 7 where digits may be repeated such that the number is divisible by 2 ?

questions.question_text_1: A box C contains 3 white balls and 2 black balls, while box D contains 4 white balls and 3 black balls. One ball is randomly selected from box C and transferred to box D. After the transfer, one ball is drawn at random from box D. What is the probability that the ball drawn from box D is black? Enter the answer correct to three decimal places.
question_texts: A box C contains 3 white balls and 2 black balls, while box D contains 4 white balls and 3 black balls. One ball is randomly selected from box C and transferred to box D. After the transfer, one ball is drawn at random from box D. What is the probability that the ball drawn from box D is black? Enter the answer correct to three decimal places.

questions.question_text_1: In how many different ways can the letters of the word ‘ARTICLE’ be arranged such that all the vowels always come together?
question_texts: In how many different ways can the letters of the word ‘ARTICLE’ be arranged such that all the vowels always come together?

questions.question_text_1: A committee of 3 people is to be formed from a group of n people. The number of possible committees in which two particular people A and B are both included together is 7. Find the number of ways in which committee can be formed.
question_texts: A committee of 3 people is to be formed from a group of n people. The number of possible committees in which two particular people A and B are both included together is 7. Find the number of ways in which committee can be formed.
